critique: This document pertains to an amendment to Regulation No. 1 under the Emergency Relief Appropriation Act of 1935. It grants the Administrator of the Works Progress Administration (WPA) the authority to require workers to make up for lost time (due to conditions beyond their control) without additional compensation, if it expedites the program. This appears to be an expansion of executive power, as it gives more discretion to the WPA Administrator. It also leans towards economic intervention, as it involves managing labor and compensation. There's no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, federalism implications, national security concerns, or social inclusion aspects. Therefore, the scores for those axes should be neutral.
